intro: Nasa callacallensis, commonly known as the Andean starflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family, which includes plants like evening primroses and willows. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and purple. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
